intro: Kraussia schlechteri, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and large, compound leaves. The tree produces yellowish-white flowers in terminal panicles, which bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a notable species in South African flora.
